page.title: 05St.Barts.Church Whittington
page.content: Saint Bartholomews is a well presented church.The present vicar Canon Hobbs has been at the church for eleveeen and a half years.Canon means someone who goes by the rule of Saint Augustan.The congretation roughly comprises of one hundred and fifty people.The population of the village is about eight hundred people.The congretation has grown twice in numbers since Canon Hobbs has been at Saint Bartholomews.About a quater of his congretation are young people. Canon Hobbs conducts four and sometimes five services in one weekend.The hymn books that he uses are "The ancient and modern revised","Sound of living water"and"Billy Graham mission prize".He uses "The Church of England Prayer Book".
